channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overgrown Verges Poor Visibility on Highcross to Cirencester rd, 20th June
item.description:
Problem is high verges & undergrowth seriously impacting visibility on a single track road from Highcross to Highgate Farm GL53 9PG & onto the underpass. This narrow lane has a national speed limit Which due to the continuing A417 Brockworth to Brimsfield Cowley road about closures & diversions this lane is experiencing a much higher volume of non local traffic. Needless to say some people are not driving to the conditions, giving dog walkers cyclists etc very little time to react or being able to get out of the way due to land topography unkept verges & shrubs

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ringway (?) blockage of road, 20th June
item.description:

item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Vehicles and building work blocking pavement, 20th June
item.description:
Pavements blocked altogether by building paraphernalia and vehicles. Impossible for anyone with a wheelchair or pushchair to pass - even pedestrians are pushed into the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.title: Dumped trailer., 20th June
item.description:
This has been reported several time by myself and my neighbours. there is and has been for many month a trailer full of rubbish with container around it. what is in the containers is anyones guess. since i reported this there has been lots of rubbish added to it and a refrigerator on the path . i am told the owner of the trailer is not worried about what happens to it. council staff water trees and empty bins in the road has any of them reported this eyesore and what could be a health hazard? it seems that as it's only hester way it get put on the back burner.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Newton Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 20th June
item.description:

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 20th June
item.description:
(See REF: 22079647) - Customer states there has been some utilities work at the Well Walk end of the churchyard pathway. We see that the utility chaps have put down black tarmac on the pathway – rather than the carefully selected resin-type surface. Pathway not reinstated properly after utility works.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Corner overgrown grass verge, 20th June
item.description:
Corner grass verges outside 34 Abbotswood Road still not cut but opposite Corner now chopped down? If I had the correct tools I would attempt to cut it myself (even though we are in our mid 70's). Please urgently arrange for this overgrown grass to be cut.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbotswood Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large delamination Lyefield Road West, 20th June
item.description:
Large delaminated patch over 30x60 cm across (bigger than a dinner plate though not quite golf ball depth). This is just beyond the stop line at the junction of Lyefield Road West with Cirencester Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Lyefield Road West, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chosen Way - roadworks blocking carriageway, 20th June
item.description:
There is a large pile of spoil blocking over half the carriageway on Chosen Way. There are no signs to inform roads users of any roadworks and has been there all week. At one point a lorry blocked the road entirely.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chosen Way, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 20th June
item.description:
Customer reporting excess foliage obscuring one side of bus stop. Elderly bus users having to stand for long periods to ensure bus driver can see them.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree on public pathway needs cutting., 19th June
item.description:
This tree is just outside mine and my neighbour’s gardens, just before the electricity sub-station on the pathway from Bicks Lane, Winchcombe. It needs cutting back as is blocking entry through the gate to my back garden.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bicks Lane, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
